boardgame.name: Build and Discover: America
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Mixture of real-time strategy game genres combined with a country building simulation and strong economic elements, all based on the history of the USA.Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: High Lords of Marn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

High Lords of Marn is a quasi-feudal setting that can best be described as Mesopotamian-Frankish in its flavor. It is a realm in which descendants of an ancient people find themselves dominated by a new culture from “far away”. In this new realm a semi- benevolent entity called Atazaan has brought together the myriad of cultures and forced them to coexist. In this realm, society is highly stratified and adherence to the Law is rigorously enforced. Those who resist know only suffering, exile, or death. For those willing to work within the Law, there is opportunity to serve the Monarch, the High Lords, or the Nithbana – an organization dedicated to serving Atazaan by exposing heresy and treason. Those who escape the Law can work as thieves, rebels, or heretics.

High Lords of Marn is a fairly unique setting in that it is not only system agnostic, it is genre agnostic as well. This setting can serve as the focus for fantasy, steampunk, post-apocalyptic, or futuristic stories. Alternatively, the setting could be used indirectly to fill the void as that “far and distant Empire” for campaigns set in a frontier area.

boardgame.name: Spritemare
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Generica Floorplans Volume 27: Throne Room
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

GENERICA Floorplans are a combination of traditional 2D maps and 3D visual aids which can help you flesh out your campaign setting. Generic fantasy town locations (such as Taverns, Temples and Shops) are showcased with carefully designed floorplans and 3D rendered views to provide your players with a more immersive gaming experience.

Each GENERICA Floorplans volume contains one 3D Exterior Mapview, two isometric top-down Floorplan Maps, as well as additional 3D renders of Interior Mapviews. Each download also includes two full-sized gameplay maps designed to be printed at 16” x 20”.

boardgame.name: Salon and Spa
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: The Child Thieves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A 3rd-5th level adventure for use with Old-School Essentials Classic Fantasy Adventure Game

Several years ago a piper happened along the poorest district of the city during the midst of the plague of rats and with his magic flute rid the people of the rats. Every year since the rats have come again, and so has the piper. In recent years the price of his services has risen, but the money of the poor has not. This year they could not pay. The angered piper left the district, cursing its residents. The next morning the people woke and found the beds of their children empty. Large rat-like tracks were found in the district leading from the homes of the missing children to the storm drains. With so little to offer for the return of their children, will the people find anyone to attempt a rescue?

boardgame.name: Blind Drive
boardgame.description: Blind Drive is an audio-based, black comedy action arcade game.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Most Creative Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.description: Delve into a world of fortune tellers and phrenologists in this twisted tale of murder and madness
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Most Creative Game of the Year Nominee

2021 AGD Awards Excellence In Accessibility Nominee

boardgame.name: Instant Warfare: Military Battle
boardgame.description:
The tides of war have fallen across the earth. Politicized radicalism has reached a breaking point and each player must fight to survive!

Instant Warfare puts you and up to 7 other people directly into the chaos. Each player represents an opposing military force, intent on keeping their way of life. Only one will survive this final battle.

Players take turns trying to eliminate each others armies through dice rolling. In games with 4 or more players, play politics by assigning each player a political alignment.

Beware the effect of policies in warfare, allegiances do not last forever and we are beyond the point of civil discussion. You never know who is planning what when politics enter Instant Warfare!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Magick Circle
boardgame.description:
Roll the dice to move clockwise round the Magick circle!
Collect Magick & Mana to attack your opponents!
The Last Wizard Standing.. Wins!

boardgame.name: Endgame
boardgame.description:
Endgame is a Chess variant which starts with the game already in progress, more or less.

Before the game starts players secretly purchase pieces using points. There is a maximum number of pieces of each type, but this is not always the same as in the standard game (e.g. a player can purchase two queens). The cost per piece goes up as more of the same type are purchased.

Once the players have their pieces they take turns placing them on the board, but all pieces except the kings (which are placed last) are placed on randomly-determined squares.

Once the pieces have been placed play proceeds according to the usual rules.

boardgame.name: Fast Track
boardgame.description:
Fast Track is played with a standard deck of cards, fourteen of which are placed on the table to form the track and fourteen of which are dealt to the players (i.e. seven each) as the horses.

The players simultaneously try to arrange their hands in an order which will get them all the way around the track. A horse card matching a track card in rank moves four spaces, in suit two spaces, and in color just one space.

When a player thinks they can get around the track they announce this and their opponent checks their solution. After the first race players switch hands and play again. If the result is tied after this a third round is played with a new track.

boardgame.name: Sashimono
boardgame.description:
A Tactical Card Game set in Sengoku Period, Japan.

You lead a coalition of allied Daimy and Samurai vying to obtain control of historic Japan. While your opponent commands an evenly matched army, they lack your selection of leadership and myriad tactics. Just as one drop in the ocean contributes to the tide, so too shall your Sashimono banners guide your army to ultimate victory!

Players assign Sashimono cards to a row or column in their 3x3 grid of Kumi cards. Based on what Kumi cards are present in that line, they may perform actions listed on the assigned Sashimono card. These actions include manipulating their own grid or starting a battle with an opponent's line of cards. The in-play Sashimono cards also have a puzzle-like scoring condition, and if met, will "Bow" (turn horizontally) into a "check" state. Your opponent then has their next turn to try to "Unbow" your scoring condition. A player wins immediately when they score 3 of their Sashimono cards.


Historic era subject brought to life by 17th century art, names, banners, and dates.



Use battle to defend your objectives or ruin your opponent's plans.



Minimal components, maximum replay, with 34 different goals.

boardgame.name: Animism
boardgame.description:
In an uncharted land after a long ice age, players take on the role of one of four tribe leaders setting out to cultivate this mysterious land using the power of spirits. For the prosperity of your tribe, connect the altars left behind by ancient civilizations with pilgrimage routes and deepen your faith in spirits. But be careful of the rival tribes! They may get in your way while taking advantage of the paths you've already built!

Animism is a pen and paper game where you write on your sheet but also other players’ until the game ends.

During the game, each player simultaneously fills in a space on the sheet they receive, then passes it to the next player.
Players fill in the sheet they receive with polyominoes of his or her own color aiming to connect the altars scattered by creating a pilgrimage route. The resources (the power of spirits) needed to purchase polyominoes can be obtained by neighboring routes with other players, but at the same time, there is a risk that your route will be blocked.

Try to get the highest score by connecting many altars on your route while trying to be adjacent to other players' routes appropriately.

The winner is the player with the highest total score on all sheets.

boardgame.name: The Tale of the Rings
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Rings of Skill, from the Shadow came…

“This ring I found under the dragon’s hoard of gold, do you think it’s valuable? When I put it on, I feel like… I can see, hear, smell everything around me!”

“Are you sure you should- maybe it’s dangerous…”

Skill checks are an essential part of tabletop gaming systems, they are the interface between the player character and the gaming world. Bonuses to skill checks, given by items, are a desirable part of treasures! Magical rings are the most romantic and alluring of treasure, and a ring of magical power is a sought-after one, indeed! But what if a sinister power decided to exploit this desire, using it to send insidious tentacles of control throughout the kingdom, and bring the world to its knees…

Within the Purple Duck Storeroom product The Tale of the Rings, you will find a campaign background scenario centered around the Rings of Skill, simple magic items to add bonuses to ordinary skill checks. There are Lesser and Greater rings… and there are the ‘True’ rings of skill. And the Gauntlet of Rings. And the Ring of Shadows, which is sought after – or wielded already- by the Lord of Shadows! By exploring The Tale of the Rings, GMs and players can engage in a desperate battle with a hidden enemy while gaining powers to make them rich and mighty.

So get The Tale of the Rings from the hapless hobbits at Purple Duck Games, and send them to seek the rings of adventure- Purple Duck Games, where our games are what you want!

boardgame.name: Archangels of Porphyra
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The time has come for the righteous and upstanding to get some recognition in the adventuring world, rather than the bloodthirsty, greedy and craven. So, Perry Fehr has written Archangels of Porphyra, a collection of exciting gaming rules and expansions from Purple Duck Games! The forces of Good and Light need some support and help, and the archangels, right-hand deities of the New Gods are here to help. Not all archangels have kept to the path of righteousness, though. Meet Elvyra, adventurer raised to godhood; Gendewitha, sorrowful angel of the wilderness; Jeremiel, gentle reaper of souls; Khamael, warrior angel; Kshathra, angelic advisor to the privileged; Lapis, stolid lieutenant of Gerana; Oneiros, angel of Dreams; Sansin, mysterious nature deity- and Zaqqit, the Fallen…

boardgame.name: Dracula's Wild Blood Drive
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your rent is past due, and you need money quick. Dracula happens to be in town, and you can make a bit of extra cash by selling some blood. After all, your landlord is a bigger bloodsucker than any vampire...

boardgame.name: Hot Diggity Dog
boardgame.description:
You are a hot dog vendor in a brand new baseball stadium looking to make a name for yourself as you get out there and sell juicy ballpark hot dogs to the hungry fans. Your manager has told you to get out there and 'SELL, SELL SELL!' and fill those seats with happy customers chowing down on your crimson crowdpleasers.

In the game Hot Diggity Dog, you grab your trusty hot dog supply box and hit the stands, looking to turn your carefully selected inventory into fistfuls of cash. Moving around the different sections of the grandstands, you look for your best opportunities to turn dogs into dollars and make the most of the nine innings before the game is over.

In Hot Diggity Dog, 2 to 5 players face off over nine innings to try and earn more in sales than than the other vendors in the grandstands.

In each turn of the game, each player has the following choices:
- Stay in the grandstand section they are in.
- Move to an open grandstand section.
- Fulfill up to 3 hot dog orders and then move to another open grandstand section.
- Go back to the Commissary and refill your depleted supplies and end your turn.

An event is revealed at the top of every inning, potentially swaying the course of play for that next turn. There is also an optional player interaction deck which allows you to get hands on in thwarting the efforts of your fellow vendors while you seize crazy opportunities to get a leg up on them yourself.

Carefully choose your placement, manage your meaty inventory, and find the best opportunities to turn dogs into dollars to see if you can be named Top Dog by the time the last 'Out' is called!

boardgame.name: Black Stories: Ab in die Kiste!
boardgame.description:
black stories: Ab in die Kiste! begins where most other black stories end: after death. This edition is all about what happens after you kick the bucket. In these 50 pitch-black riddles, bizarre stories are gathered around interesting ways to celebrate your eternal rest. And the most chilling thing about these stories: they really happened that way. Adventurous, funny, sometimes quite illegal - and 100% true! To match this theme, the coffin-shaped cards of the "black stories: Ab in die Kiste!" come in a high-quality box in coffin look, which makes the puzzle stories look even scarier.

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

boardgame.name: Gevangen op zee
Seefahrt ins Ungewisse
boardgame.description:
Seefahrt ins Ungewisse ("Sailing into the Uncertain") is an escape game full of riddles and puzzles that consists only of cards.
After their first night aboard the historic sailing ship Enigma, the players discover: all the doors are locked with cryptic riddles. And the crew has disappeared without a trace. Working together as a team, they must decipher the clues to open all the locks on board. This is the only way they can free themselves.

How to play:
Together as a group, the players must first find out which crew member lives in which cabin. Then they have to solve the corresponding riddle for each cabin. In this way, they gradually find the clues to what has happened on board. Can the players solve the mystery of where the crew disappeared to? Different puzzles are waiting to be solved by the team in order to decipher the codes. The players can check whether they are right with a hidden solution on the back of the cards, which only becomes visible when the cards are placed next to each other.

By the way: The game material remains intact and can therefore be used again and again.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 60 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 12+

Nach ihrer ersten Nacht an Bord des historischen Segelschiffs Enigma stellen sie fest: Alle Tren sind mit kryptischen Rtseln verschlossen und die Crew ist spurlos verschwunden. Um die Schlsser an Bord zu ffnen, mssen die Spieler*innen gemeinsam im Team die Hinweise entschlsseln und die kniffligen Rtsel lsen. Nur mit intensiver Zusammenarbeit knnen sie es schaffen, sich vom Bord der Enigma zu befreien.
Dieses handliche Escape-Game ist ein reines Kartenspiel und eignet sich perfekt fr Einsteiger, denn die auf den ersten Blick kleine Schachtel bietet riesengroen Rtselspa. Alle Rtsel mssen gelst werden, um letztendlich das finale Rtsel der verschlossenen Ausgangstr lsen zu knnen. Wie kam es dazu? - Gemeinsam als Gruppe mssen die Spieler*innen zuerst herausfinden, welches Crewmitglied in welcher Kabine wohnt. - Danach gilt es, zu jeder Kabine auch das passende Rtsel zu lsen. - So finden sie nach und nach die Hinweise, was sich an Bord zugetragen hat. - Knnen die Spieler das Geheimnis lften, wohin die Crew verschwunden ist?
Inhalt + 90 Spielkarten + 1 Spielanleitung
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Black Stories Junior: Magic Stories
boardgame.description:
The successful mystery series "black stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "black stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Magic Stories contains enchanting riddles full of glittering secrets all about cotton candy-farting unicorns, heroic dragon slayers, or mixed-up potions. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

boardgame.name: (Red Memory)
boardgame.description:
,“”,,,
The game is a China-themed board game that integrates educational and fun features. The teaching aids are based on key events in the 100-year history of the Communist Party of China, and the design intention of "long history and tide of the times" is selected, and the content of party history education is scientifically combined with pedagogy and game science, so that participants can fully understand and understand the party. History and classic events. Relying on past accumulation of party history knowledge and familiarity with game strategies, game participants can feel the hardships and glory of the 100-year history of the Communist Party of China in an immersive manner. In the process of participating in each tributary of events into the long river of party history, no one is absent. I ignite a sense of identity and belonging to the country from the heart.

boardgame.name: (Golden Bugle)
boardgame.description:
The game is a Chinese People's Liberation Army(PLA) history-themed board game that integrates educational and interesting features. The teaching aids are based on key events in the history of the Chinese PLA, and the design intention of “long history, tide of the times” is selected, and the content of military history education is scientifically combined with pedagogy and game science, so that participants can fully understand and deeply understand the Chinese people. The history and classic events of the People's Liberation Army. Relying on the past accumulation of military history knowledge and familiarity with game strategies, game participants can immersely feel the hardships and glory of the Chinese PLA’s journey. As the participants merge each tributary of events into the long river of military history, no one does nothing. I kind of reverence for the army from the heart.
“”

boardgame.name: (Ink Colored Mountains and Rivers)
boardgame.description:
The game is a card board game designed based on the major events of China since 1949, with the image of "long history and tide of times". Even if you have a deep understanding of history, you need strategic arrangements. You need to make reasonable arrangements to bring the events connected by the year together, converge into the mainstream with tributaries, keep pace with the trend of the times, and learn the history of China subtly in the game.
This version sets advanced rules and competition rules, giving you more experience.
1949“”

boardgame.name: Eleven: Unexpected Events
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds two new mechanics: Breaking News cards which trigger the keywords you can find on Player cards and the Reputation track, as well as 14 new Board Meeting cards.
Breaking News
During Matchday read a Breaking News card with the press coverage of your match to see if any of your Players’ keywords are mentioned. This may trigger an unexpected consequence for your game with your match ending differently than you expected!
All 36 Breaking News cards have unique outcomes making each gameplay different and adding an amazing thematic flavor to your experience.
New Board Meeting cards
Increase the replayability of your game with 14 new Board Meeting cards that you can add to the base game.
Reputation track
New Breaking News and Board Meeting cards from this expansion influence the Reputation level of your club, which is marked on the new Reputation track. Depending on your Reputation level, your club will gain benefits or penalties in the upcoming Matches.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Eleven: Stadium Expansion
boardgame.description:
Make your Stadium a cultural center for the whole city with 50 new cards and 24 new Infrastructure tiles.

Get new Sponsors, hire new Staff members and make your Stadium a cultural center for the whole city! Build new elements, run concerts and national team matches, and more!

The Stadium expansion adds 24 new custom shaped Stadium Infrastructure tiles and 50 cards including new Objective, Staff, Sponsor, and Board Meeting cards that are related to the Infrastructure tiles from this expansion.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Eleven: International Players
boardgame.description:
A set of Player cards dedicated to advanced play, and a new Travel mechanic.

An expansion introducing new Players with interesting abilities and showing the wonderful diversity of football around the globe, and a new Travel mechanic.
New Players and Tactics from around the world
Discover 45 new Player cards representing 45 different countries and 5 new Tactic cards showing specific styles of play, such as Spanish tiki-taka, German gegenpressing, or English kick and rush.
This set of Player cards is especially useful in advanced play as each of them adds an interesting ability.
Travel mechanic
Travel between different continents by spending Distance markers to purchase the best international Players for your club.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Eleven: International Cup
boardgame.description:
Do you have what it takes to play in the league on weekends and in the International Cup on Wednesdays?
The International Cup expansion introduces a single-elimination tournament board where winning each match is of utmost importance.
It also adds 14 International teams and 50 new cards, including Board Meeting cards showing International events, and new Opponent cards for the added teams.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Eleven: Solo Campaign
boardgame.description:
A big solo campaign consisting of 8 scenarios tied together by an overarching story. Play a series of games throughout several seasons with the goal of reaching the big league. Whatever happens in one scenario may influence the scenarios that follow.
This expansion adds 36 Solo cards that affect gameplay and your progress in the campaign, as well as 14 new cards for the multiplayer mode including new Objective, Director, and Board Meeting cards, increasing the overall variability in the base game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tough Cookie
boardgame.description: A Fiasco

boardgame.name: 'mo Cheese, 'mo Mouse
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Every mouse loves cheese and with this supplement: MORE CHEESE = MORE MAUS!

boardgame.name: Regnum
boardgame.description:
In Regnum, the kingdoms with the most inhabitants and the best resources are the most prosperous. In this game you must get the most valuable characters to settle around your castle. You will have to develop your strategy by taking into account the advantage of your castle and the standards.

Be wary of the other castles, as they will all want to steal your best characters. Will you be able to make your kingdom the most prosperous and proclaim yourself victorious?

Each player receives a castle card at random and places it in front of them. Each castle has a particular advantage that must be used wisely.

Randomly put the number of standard on the table that is equal to the number of players plus one (3 banners for 2 players, 4 for 3 and so on). The standards are displayed for everyone to see and will be scored at the end of the game.

Next, shuffle the character cards and place them face down to form a deck. Next, turn over the first 4 and line them up next to the deck. These are the inhabitants available for populating your kingdom.

Shuffle the resource cards and deal 4 cards to each player. The rest are left face down on the table in a deck, on the other side of the character line-up. The first card is turned over and used to start the discard pile. The player with the most regal bearing starts.

How the game works

The person whose turn it is must perform these two actions in the following order:


Draw resource cards. You can choose to draw two resource cards from the top of the deck (unseen) or take the top card from the discard pile.
Add a character to your realm. To do this, select one of the available characters and pay for it by discarding cards from your hand that show the resources indicated. If you can do this, take the character from the line and place it in front of you. This makes them an inhabitant of your realm. If you cannot, or do not want to add a character to your realm, you must discard a resource card from your hand. You can buy as many characters as your resources allow.


Each character has a resource cost and an effect on the game that is shown on the card. This effect must be implemented immediately after acquiring that character. Caution: some characters affect other cards.

At the end of your turn you must always replace any characters that have been bought from the line-up on the table by taking more cards from the character deck. This way, there will always be four characters available for the next player.  

The game ends when there are no cards left in one of the two decks (either resources or characters). When the last card is drawn, a final round is played.

Once the round is over, each bonus score standard is assigned to the player who best fulfils its condition. If there is a tie, no one wins that standard (unless you have Montreaux Castle). Each standard won adds 3 points to the final score.

To find out who the winner is, the players must add up the points earned by the characters in their realm plus the points awarded by any standards they have won.

If the final score is tied, the player with the most inhabitants in their kingdom wins.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Doggy Scratch
boardgame.description:
Why does everything itch? I can't stop scratching! Oh no! Are those... fleas? Use your cards to get rid of them and pass them on to your opponents. Be smart and get rid of as many fleas as you can, but watch out for veteran fleas, because they are tricky customers.

Be the dog with the least fleas at the end of the game and win. Are you starting to feel your whole body itch?

When it is their turn, the player plays as many action cards from their hand as they want. Once they have played, they decide whether to draw 1, 2 or 3 cards from the deck and they say this out loud. Next, they draw the number of cards they have said, one after the other. They put the action cards they have drawn into their hand and the flea cards in front of them. The player's turn then ends and they cannot play any more cards. The turn passes to the player on the left.

The game ends as soon as one of the players collects 5 flea cards in front of them.

That player cannot win the game. The rest of the players count the number of fleas they have on each card, and whoever has the fewest wins the game. If there is a tie, the player who has the fewest veteran fleas wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Monk's Cowl
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Henry Denny, the leaseholder of Waltham manor, sends word of a monstrous threat harrowing travellers passing through Waltham Forest. John Dee sends the Agents to the market town of Waltham Abbey to investigate.

As one of the favoured hunting grounds of the Queen, the Agents must resolve the matter with haste—who would dare to disappoint Her Majesty?

boardgame.name: The Harrowing of Harlow Hall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“A former agent hath shewn himself to be in league with ruinous powers. Investigate and deal with him, as thou deem most fit.”

John Dee dispatches the Agents to investigate both the grounds and owner of Harlow Hall, one of the few individuals to earn his freedom from the Dee Sanction.

boardgame.name: Riiing!
boardgame.description:
The alarm clock rings and you're already got up on the wrong side of the bed. Daily routines can sometimes put the brakes on your best days.

Burnt toast, slip in the shower and spilled coffee will slow you down in your race to start the day. Overcome all the obstacles, be the first to discard all your cards and win before the bus leaves without you.

Preparation
Shuffle all the cards and deal seven cards to each player. Turn over the top card from the deck to make the discard pile. The person who gets up earliest starts.

How the game works
When it is your turn, play a card from your hand on the last card played or, if you can't, draw a card from the deck. Then the turn passes to the player on your left.

To play a card from your hand, it must match the condition on the back of the top card of the deck (+,-,=...).

If you can't play a card from your hand because you don't have a card that meets the condition, draw a card from the deck. This changes the condition for the next player, and the turn then passes to the person on your left.

There are also some special cards that can be played at any time regardless of the condition shown on the top card (burnt toast, dropped soap, broken alarm clock...).

The game ends when a player gets rid of all the of cards in their hand. Now you're ready to get on the bus and start your day in the best way!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Brace Yourself! Combat Training Module 3: Fighting Creatures
Wappne dich!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The giantess Tadc and her bear companion, Terrorpaw, have seized a group of terrified villagers and hold them in Tadc's lair. A rescue party has been assembled to free the villagers and end the giantess's reign of fear over the land.

The third in our series of Combat Training modules, Brace Yourself deals with fighting creatures. Both the foes in this module (the giantess Tadc and her bear companion Terrorpaw) are larger and stronger than the characters, and use different tactics when fighting. They therefore require a different approach if they are to be defeated.

Brace Yourself! explores the options available to both players and GMs, and shows how different fighting styles can be used to handle multiple foes simultaneously. It also shows the importance of terrain and advantageous positioning - useful things to exploit no matter what size the opponent.

As with all the Combat Modules in this series, Brace Yourself! includes a tactical map and downloadable tokens for use at the table or in a virtual tabletop environment such as Roll20 or Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Beaugrey Hall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A long-forgotten ruin, with an extensive secret dungeon

Beaugrey Hall is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Beaugrey Hall is a day & night set, comprising of five 30x30 battlemaps. Day, night, jungle and winter versions of this location, plus an old dungeon/cellar which has a lich in residence!

A ruined manor house/castle, with access to a dank and old dungeon.

boardgame.name: What Lies Below
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Welcome to the first of many adventures in the Quick Encounters product line for Five Torches Deep by ThrowiGames, LLC These short books are designed as random encounters or small one-session scenarios for use with little time for preparation. Each of these products will initially be available as PDFs but may be printed as a single volume at a later date. Note that while the adventure was written for Five Torches Deep, it will use the ThrowiGames Sensory Descriptive Style (SDS) format.

What Lies Below takes characters into a druid’s tomb below a rotten stump. The characters will quickly find that the druids buried within dabbled in magic and enchantments well outside their traditional schools.

This adventure was designed for 2-4 characters of first level. 8 pages, B&W. Unedited version.

boardgame.name: The Cistern: Sewer Shanty Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The long-forgotten city cistern - now the site of a busy shanty town

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting the sewer system beneath a city, used as a shanty town for refugees or outlaws.

Also includes an empty version

boardgame.name: Mandible Hill Giant Ant Nest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be careful if you travel near Mandible Hill - the ants are hungry!

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of a 6 30x30 battlemaps, depicting a giant ant nest
Surface- three variants of the surface; day, winter and night.
Level 1 - winding tunnels used as larders and stores
Level 2 - Nursery level, filled with eggs
Level 3 - The Queen's Chamber

We've included an non-egg version too, so you can use the tunnels for other dangers (ghoul tunnels??)

boardgame.name: New Atami Arcade
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone loves the penny-waterfall!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a futuristic cyberpunk city arcade, with a brightly neon lit street, and plenty of video game machines!

boardgame.name: The Victory Shopping Network Issue 03, Volume 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE Network for Buying Your Chance at Victory!

On an obscure channel and nestled into an odd spot on the web, you can find the Victory Shopping Network. Most people have no use for the weapons, armor, and other gear sold there, but Adventurers sure do!

Join hosts Jack Tolouse and Rebecca Mary-Ann Abernathy (the world-famous RMA) as they present another set of items that might, jsut MIGHT, offer you a chance at Victory!

This issue; you can't afford to miss Jack's "Special of the Day:" a classic White Tie & Tails tuxedo that serves as highly effective body armor!

(Shopping Network offer only the chance of victory; you will need to provide the actual victory yourself. All sales are final. No warranty is offered, implied, or exists. Do not call your cable provider. Operators are not standing by).

boardgame.name: Escape from the Two Base Stations
boardgame.description:
Escape from the Two Base Stations is a new style of escape game kit that allows two players in different locations to play together using a video call app of their choice.

With no time limit on it, anyone can experience an authentic escape game with this game kit! The only catch? You'll need to find a friend to send the other half of the game kit to, and cooperate with each other to solve the puzzles.

One side will have the "North Pole Kit" and the other will have the "South Pole Kit". Progress through the story together by sharing information from each unique kit through a video call app of your choice.

This remote communication game must be played by 2 parties over video call, where one side has the North Pole Kit and the other side has the South Pole Kit physically with them. The game cannot be played with only one of the kits.

boardgame.name: Agents of BAMF (ICONS)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Agents of BAMF is a heartfelt homage to the trope of the Super Spy Agency (SHIELD, UNCLE, BPRD, GI Joe etc).

BAMF stands for the Bureau of Abnormalities, Mutations and the Fantastic. When there’s something too weird, spooky or otherworldly for the cops or the army - you call BAMF.

boardgame.name: Agents of BAMF (Black Hack)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Agents of BAMF is an OSR-inspired tabletop roleplaying game,

Agents of BAMF is a heartfelt homage to the trope of the Super Spy Agency (SHIELD, UNCLE, BPRD, GI Joe etc).

BAMF stands for the Bureau of Abnormalities, Mutations and the Fantastic. When there’s something too weird, spooky or otherworldly for the cops or the army - you call BAMF.

boardgame.name: Agents of BAMF: Helicarrier Hijinks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who doesn’t love a helicarrier?

The venerable flying fortress has become one of the most iconic settings within superhero media. Whirling turbines, tons of armed troops, and the constant peril of crashing to earth make a helicarrier into an ideal setting for a superhero game.

In this adventure, the heroes infiltrate the flying HQ of a super-science criminal organization.

Their mission will be to steal a dire world-ending device and escape without getting caught. (So, essentially, this scenario is the last act of a superhero heist movie. The fun part - where everything goes sideways.)

Helicarrier Heist is a short scenario, designed to be played in an evening or two. Included are several pre-gen characters to get the action started quickly.

boardgame.name: Paladin Oath: Oath of the Fairies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A paladin swearing the Oath of the Fairies binds themselves to an Archfey, a powerful creature who scoffs at the powers traditionally worshipped by mortal races. Though similar in terms of sheer magical ability, the Fey derive their power from a mixture of the arcane and raw emotion. The Archfey can be seen as unpredictable or temperamental, but a paladin sworn to their service typically feels a kindred spirit between them, and often sees logic where others see chaos (though others may perceive the paladin themselves as chaotic as well).

Expanding upon the mechanics of the 5E Paladin class, this PDF provides a new Oath option for paladins to pledge their services to the Archfey, gaining resistances to mind-altering magic and eerie powers from sylvan poetry. The PDF also contains the Feyborn background, compatible with characters of any class, representing those whose paths have already crossed with the Fey before becoming adventurers.

boardgame.name: Wortfabrik
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Word Factory! We produce fresh letters every day and your job is to turn them into words that work. Please use spare parts carefully and avoid wastage – rejects will be deducted from your wages at the end of the week. Do you have the right combination of skill and strategy to be "employee of the week"?

The player with the 5 letter dice rolls them and places them in the middle of the table so they are clearly visible to all players. The letters rolled are for use by all employees.

Choose at least 4 of the letters rolled and enter them in any fields in the word rows on your delivery note. If you cannot or do not want to use any of the letters that have just been rolled, you can enter them in the spare parts line or the rejects line.

End:
After 6 rounds (working-days) the game ends. Award points based on completed words and the empty boxes in your spare parts and rejects rows.

The player with the most points is the "employee of the week" and wins the game.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 6 Spieldauer: 20 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 12+
Wortfabrik Derzeit boomen Roll & Write Spiele, bei denen zuerst gewrfelt und dann das Ergebnis notiert und gewertet wird. So wie in der Wortfabrik, in der die richtige Mischung aus Grips und Taktik zhlt. Wie der Name Wortfabrik schon andeutet, geht es darum, mglichst viele Wrter zu erstellen. Die Basis dafr liefern fnf Buchstabenwrfel, deren Ergebnis immer fr alle gilt. Die jeweiligen Buchstaben drfen in jeder Runde, die einem Arbeitstag entspricht, in beliebige Felder auf einem Lieferschein eingetragen werden, um sinnvolle Wrter zu bilden.
Die fertigen Begriffe mssen exakt in die einzelnen Wortreihen passen. Aber keine Regel ohne Ausnahmen: Eine Bonusreihe erlaubt auch krzere Wrter und mithilfe eines Jokers darf ein beliebiger Buchstabe definiert werden. Ein gut bestcktes Ersatzteillager hilft, den Produktionsfluss nicht zu unterbrechen. Wie in jedem Unternehmen luft allerdings auch hier nicht immer alles wunschgem: Zuweilen wird Mangelware produziert, was in diesem Spiel nicht mehr einsetzbare Buchstaben sind, die bei der Endabrechnung zu Punktabzgen fhren.
In der Wortfabrik gilt die Sechs-Tage-Woche, es werden also immer sechs Runden hintereinander gespielt. Wer bei der anschlieenden Prfung der Lieferscheine und der gebildeten Wrter die meisten Punkte erzielt hat, darf sich Fachkraft der Woche nennen.
https://youtu.be/8YN_oCkyef4
Inhalt: 1 Block mit Lieferscheinen 5 Buchstaben Wrfel 1 Spielanleitung Zustzlich bentigt jede Fachkraft einen Stift!
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Banshee's Gasp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“They said when she opened her mouth, the ground shook, the air trembled and the world seemed to fear her words. In the end, there was nothing but a whimpered shriek.”

For Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Power/Spheres of Might systems, this apocrypha introduces a new path for the Hedgewitch focused around vocal powers reminiscent of the mythical banshees, as well as an assortment of talents and feats relating to the undead spirits and their powers. Shriek and spread miseries to your opponents until they beg for their lives.

boardgame.name: Infernal Tranquility (OSE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dangerous cult begins to transform a peaceful town into a chaotic haven for madness. Will you stop their machinations or will infernal spirits destroy everything you hold dear? In this adventure players will guide their PCs in the defense of Tradesman’s Root, a small settlement wedged in between a large plateau and a dark forest. Nature, dark forces, and political intrigue all conspire against the PCs to bring the downfall of the once proud townsfolk.

Infernal Tranquility is an adventure for 4-6 1st or 2nd level characters. Infernal Tranquility can be used with any fantasy setting the GM desires.

Inside you will find;

A 28 page fantasy adventure, usable with nearly any fantasy setting;
4-10 hours of play, depending on playstyle;
Choices that matter.

boardgame.name: Delayed Transmission
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The crew of the Cormorant, employees of a terrestrial megacorp, have been dispatched to an unfamiliar system in a remote arm of the galactic sector. Their instructions are simple: rendezvous planetside with a corporate representative, who will have further instructions; provide basic support.

But things on Tethys-IV haven't been simple lately...

Delayed Transmission is a pamphlet scenario for the Mothership RPG. The full scenario is contained within a trifold pamphlet (i.e., both sides of a single sheet of paper).

For just a few of your monies, you get all of the following:

Delayed Transmission pamphlet scenario
Warden's map (numbered)
Player-facing map (unnumbered)
Mission briefing handout

boardgame.name: Hunt a Killer: Body on the Boardwalk
boardgame.description:
When Katie Dunn, an employee at a seaside amusement park, turns up dead inside a popular ride, her boyfriend quickly becomes the prime suspect. The suspect’s mother reaches out to you in hopes of clearing his name, but even she has to admit that the evidence against her son looks bad. Could someone else have had a score to settle with the victim, or is the boyfriend as guilty as he looks? Behind the boardwalk’s picturesque facade lies a criminal underworld where everyone’s got something to hide.

To figure out who killed Katie, you must reconstruct her path along the boardwalk on the day she died, and work out what secret she discovered that ultimately led to her death. Uncovering the crimes perpetrated by the other boardwalk employees will lead you to the identity of Katie’s true killer.

listing.notes: All original materials included in original packaging. Zero visible wear.

boardgame.name: Stjl et rim
boardgame.description:
A Danish rhyming game with a stack of picture cards.

At the beginning of the game, a card is flipped.
Each player will spend their turn flipping a new card and seeing if two cards rhyme (like 'house' and 'mouse' - this rhyme also woks in English). Cards that are also in a trick can also be taken, stealing the trick. If there is a rhyme, the player takes the cards as a trick. If not, the newly flipped card is placed on the table next to the already flipped card(s). If the active player sees no rhyme, the other players may see if they can find a rhyme and take the trick.

Keep going until all cards have been flipped and potentially converted into tricks. The player with most cards wins.

boardgame.name: Posse Comitatus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An act of violence puts the PCs squarely in the middle of conditions in a lawless mining colony and in the crosshairs of the colony’s would-be dictator, a rogue mercenary determined to bend the installation to her iron will. The heroes’ interference allows a distress signal to finally be dispatched, but until help arrives the occupiers must be shown that law and order prevail, and it’s up to the band of adventurers to deliver it. On a world where life is cheap and death comes at a moment’s notice, can the heroes prove themselves up to the task?

Posse Comitatus is an adventure designed for Cepheus Engine and other 2D6 science-fiction RPGs, including the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: On the Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the journeys in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: Nancy Drew Mystery at Magnolia Gardens
boardgame.description: When Nancy Drew begins to investigate a potential poisoning at the botanical garden known as Magnolia Gardens, she soon becomes poisoned herself. In the small window before her symptoms take hold, Nancy manages to collect all of the evidence the player will need, and to interview the potential suspects. Someone at Magnolia Gardens is using the facility’s dangerous plants for nefarious purposes, and Nancy needs your help to find out who before the culprit strikes again. To unearth the culprit, the player must figure out which suspect had the means, motive, and opportunity to commit the crime.

boardgame.name: The Beating of the Aquiline Heart (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Finale

In the stunning finale to the War of the Burning Sky campaign saga, the heroes lead their armies on a final assault against the might of the Ragesian Empire and cut the heart out of their foe, the tyrannical Leska.

Companies of fiends, legions of deadly warriors, furious beasts, and titanic creations defend the desolate Opaline Wastes, for in the caverns below, Empress Leska crafts dark sorcery which will bind the world to eternal war.

From the throne room of the imperial palace to the ash-stained fields of war, to the ancient and accursed Heart of History, epic dangers loom against the heroes, and tens of thousands will fight and bleed and die at their side to save their many homelands, for both the end of the war and the fate of the world are tied to the beating of the Aquiline Heart.

A 5E fantasy adventure for 19th-level characters and beyond.

boardgame.name: Hunt A Killer: The Moon Summit Mystery Box Set
boardgame.description:
A graduate student named Toby Mendia appears to have died from a fatal bear attack while on a scientific expedition in Moon Summit Park, Alaska. Although the case closed in the summer of 2018, a friend of Toby’s has reached out to you, thinking there might be something strange surrounding his death. Was Toby murdered? If so, why – and by whom?

Players channel their inner detective to investigate the suspected murder in Moon Summit Park, Alaska. Uncover the motives of each suspect through ciphers, clues, and puzzles that progress the story to its thrilling conclusion.

The Moon Summit Mystery Complete Box Set contains the full season (6 episodes) of the previous Hunt A Killer subscription series.

boardgame.name: Terraternity: The Card Challenge
boardgame.description:
Terraternity: The Card Challenge is a fast-playing strategic card game for 2-6 players. Master a touch of dexterity and overcome the challenges of reducing CO2 with renewable energy sources.

Your goal is to develop renewable power plants in various countries to make them carbon neutral. You will first need to play a country card to ‘activate’ it, which lets you build renewable power plants within it but adding its CO2 output - literally! - to the Terraternity globe. You’ll need to make sure this globe stays balanced - too many CO2 cubes, and you risk a climate disaster. Whoever balances five countries first is the winner!

boardgame.name: Legendary Bloodragers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood Boils with Unbridled Power!

Legendary Bloodragers is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements, this time focusing on warriors whose ancestry gives them arcane power and explosive bursts of energy! This hybrid class introduced for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game combines sorcerous power with the sheer strength of barbaric fury. Legendary Bloodragers gives the class more tools--both magical and mundane--to face any challenge, with 16 bloodlines to shape their power and identity. The raw power of the arcane bloodline counters enemy spellcasters, while the anger of kaiju bloodragers grants the size and monstrous physique of their ancestors and shadow bloodragers feed on the fear they inspire from their umbral hiding places. With nearly 20 new feats and amazing archetypes, you can tailor your bloodrager in myriad ways, from the brewmaster sharing her rage through her concoctions, the seidmadr sacrificing martial strength for increased magical power, and the shapeshifting ulfhednar going truly wild! Plus sample legendary bloodrager Brighid ni Taranis shows off all the terrific tricks of this brutal class, along with a detailed history and boons she can offer PC allies!

boardgame.name: European Folklore Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,
Than are dreamt of in your philosophy
(William Shakespeare, Hamlet)

The Folklore Bestiary continues the mission of Chivalry & Sorcery to provide a fantasy roleplaying experience with an authentic medieval flavor.

Drawn from legends and lore across western Europe, this book presents more than sixty magical and monstrous creatures that fit perfectly in a medieval fantasy setting – because the people of the Middle Ages believed that they existed!

Some are harmless - beyond a few pranks - and some are terrifying beasts that can threaten whole cities. Some will be familiar, but many are presented for fantasy games for the first time ever. A bibliography featuring online resources as well as books allows you to pursue the tales behind these monsters, finding inspiration for encounters and even for full adventures. The Folklore Bestiary supplements the Chivalry & Sorcery 5th Edition Core rulebook and gives you endless potential for adventure.

More than 60 monsters from across the world as medieval Europeans knew it
Multiple variants for many creatures
Drawn from authentic Classical, medieval, and folklore sources

boardgame.name: Splendor: Daiji and the Duke of Zhou Promo Tiles
boardgame.description:
Two new nobles tiles to be used for Splendor.

Artwork included one female and male noble---Daji () and the Duke of Zhou ().

Both of them are alternate art for tiles in the base game.

The bottom right hand corner of each tile is marked with a “p” to indicate that it is a promotional noble.

boardgame.name: EroTech Gazetteer Number 1
boardgame.description:
This issue:

World background
The Automaton character option
SO. MANY. ELVES!
Hellblooded character options
A god-hating divine domain
Baron Kadaggar, a warlock patron
Odozarra, Goddess of Blood!
The Red Rope Serpent artefact
The Island City of Tegrum
A typical Regency-style townhouse, with maps
The Blue Ball, adventure set-up
NPC: Captain Luther 'Snakebeard' Silk
NPC: Michelle, the piratical dragon turtle
NPC: The Blue Death
NPC: The Little Death
Monster: Yegis Soldier Automaton

boardgame.name: EroTech Gazetteer Number 2
boardgame.description:
This issue:

Cosmology
The Yegis
Class: The Tinkerer
Race: The Half-Dead
Junk Island
Junk Crabs
Thaumaturgical Ooze
The Island of Usilazi
The Port of Tatlurzuk
Fertility Temple
Temple of the Barren

boardgame.name: Erotech Gazetteer Number 3
boardgame.description:
From Publisher:

A guide to Keranius - the pirate isle!

People, places, things, new races and a revised version of the Artificer.

boardgame.name: EroTech Gazetteer Number 4
boardgame.description:
From Publisher:

The newest EroTech gazetteer with information on the world, new races, maps and information on Vimana. There's a lot here to bring into your own games, or to help you get more bang for your buck from the Tabletopless streams at Plexstorm.

boardgame.name: Trial by Cipher
boardgame.description:
The Infiniti Institutes is an institution like no other. They are dedicated to discovering truth wherever it may be hidden and preserving it for all to experience. Their methods are, however, far from stodgy academics one might imagine.

With field agents across the globe infiltrating every nook and cranny of the world, data is constantly incoming. Of course, it's largely encoded, so The Institutes department of cryptography is its largest and most-funded, seeking out the best and brightest every year to join its ranks.

Trial by Cipher is your entrance exam. Do you have what it takes to join The Institutes and assist with the Great Understanding?

boardgame.name: Kingdoms: Ascendance
boardgame.description:
A card game played with a standard 52-card deck (plus 2 Jokers). This is a hack of War which adds strategy without losing the spirit of the original game.

In Kingdoms: Ascendance, wage war in a duel on 3 fronts, protect your castles, and weaken the opposing forces. Your goal is to earn cards and win wars, but as you continue to play, exhaustion starts to set in--forcing you to make compromises to your castles and pray that a war doesn’t occur. You always feel about as close to winning as you are to losing.

The game is played in 3 phases: Draw Cards, Play Cards (initiate War), and Recruit.

If a player is unable to draw up to their hand size, unable to contribute to War, or have only 1 castle standing--that player immediately loses.

The game has no win condition, only 3 lose conditions. This reflects our own beliefs that war has no winners. Even when you have technically won the game, you may look down at your Kingdom and realize how much weaker it has become than when you started.

boardgame.name: Migratory Patterns
boardgame.description:
The present becomes the past. Fact becomes legend. And artifacts become myth. Throughout the ages countless works of immeasurable beauty and history have been lost to the ravages of time, their memory turned into nothing more than whispers of something that probably never existed...

...or did it?

Now, an Institutes researcher has tracked down some of these artifacts, scattered around the world in dusty, forgotten corners just waiting to be discovered and shown to the world. But The Institutes aren't the only ones looking for these treasures, and the others' intentions aren't nearly so altruistic. So hurry and decipher the incoming data so field agents can be dispatched to retrieve the artifacts before it's too late!

boardgame.name: Cryptic Cryptids
boardgame.description:
How much do you know about the creatures that populate the earth right alongside us? Zoology is a rich field, filled with millions of species and sub-species. And that's to say nothing of its sister field: cryptozoology.

One of the smallest departments at The Institutes, the department of cryptozoology is made up of just four very dedicated people. Largely a theoretical field, little concrete data has ever existed over the years. But with your help, that is about to change

One department member has set out on a research trip to verify unsubstantiated claims of a number of cryptids. Their trip has gone from pleasant to dangerous in the blink of an eye, and all of it will be for naught if you can't decode and catalog the information they've sent back.

boardgame.name: Metrolijn
Voll verplant
boardgame.description:
In Voll verplant, players create subway networks by filling in the station spaces on their individual game sheets. Using the numbers revealed by the cards, all players fill up their subway map with Xs in the station spaces. However, the number of times they can add stations to each line is limited, so they have to make tough choices. Players can score many points by getting their star bonuses in stations with many intersecting routes. Players also get bonuses by being the first to complete routes. Try to fill in all your stations to minimize the penalties and achieve a high score!

In more detail, each player has their own sheet of paper, with the game including subway maps for Amsterdam, Berlin, Paris, and Madrid, with the first two being recommended for new players. Each sheet shows an interwoven subway system, with the system consisting of many subway lines; each line has a name, a number of indicator boxes, a number of empty station boxes on the subway route, and two bonuses. On a turn, a player reveals the top indicator card from the deck of fourteen cards, then each player individually and simultaneously chooses a subway line, then does something depending on which type of card is revealed:


If a number is revealed, the player writes the number in one of that line's indicator boxes, then draws a X in each box in the line starting with the closest empty box, stopping when they've reached the end of the line, reached an already filled-in space, or drawn the indicated number of Xs.
If a circled number is revealed, the player does what is described above, but they can skip over already filled-in spaces instead of stopping.
If a star is revealed, the player draws a star in one of that line's indicator boxes, then in the closest empty space on that line they write a number equal to double the number of lines that pass through that station box.
If a circle is revealed, the player writes nothing in an indicator box and draws a X in any empty station box.


At the end of a turn, if a player has finished a subway line by reaching the final space, they announce this to all players, then score the larger of the two bonuses for this line; all other players cross out the large bonus and can score the small bonus for themselves if they complete this line later. Multiple players can score a line's bonus on the same turn. If the indicator card has a shuffle icon on it, shuffle all of the indicator cards together before the next turn.

Once all the indicator boxes are filled, the game ends. Players tally their points scored for completing lines and for writing numbers in boxes, then lose points based on the number of empty spaces that remain on their sheet. Whoever has the highest score wins!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Veritas
boardgame.description:
The combined library of human knowledge here on earth dwindles in comparison to the knowledge spread through the universe around us. Secrets that we can only scratch the surface of lurk just beyond our grasp.

Now, you have a chance to uncover some of the greatest secrets of the cosmos, knowledge that will alter the way you see the world and your place in it.

You may never be the same again after deciphering the messages you've received from an old Institutes alum, but you're going to do your best despite that. After all, this is what you signed up for.

boardgame.name: Cabin Fever
boardgame.description:
Visual novel about off-the-grid living in a tech world.

User Summary

boardgame.name: ENIGMAS
boardgame.description:
A multi-layered Puzzle Hunt experience within a luxury deck of playing cards. Solve puzzles, crack codes and discover secret messages!

ENIGMAS combines all of these exciting and intriguing worlds. Puzzles within puzzles within puzzles, within a luxury deck of custom playing cards. And all of this is themed on an estate shrouded in mystery called Riverbank ...

Included within this fully functional, seemingly regular deck of playing cards are four very special cards, each with its own puzzle for you to solve.

Solving all four puzzles will unlock an incredible, multilayered, eight-step puzzle hunt expertly designed by Dave Shukan, master puzzle-maker. Combine answers from every puzzle you've solved along the way and you will reveal the final, meta-puzzle answer. A true puzzler’s paradise!

ENIGMAS are themed on a fascinating historical place -- a mysterious estate outside of Chicago called Riverbank. Over one hundred years ago, the scientists at Riverbank worked on cryptography projects: the estate was filled with secret messages and codes. And exotic animals like alligators, peacocks, monkeys and bears roamed the property!

Illustrator Billy French has masterfully captured all of these bizarre and beautiful elements into the ENIGMAS design. The card backs are adorned with historically accurate imagery from the Riverbank estate, like its windmill and lighthouse. Owls, representing wisdom and learning, are perched on the bookshelves, guarding its secrets.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: The United States Playing Card Company

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Rise of the Sith - Dark Forces
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A raid on an Imperial Base has yielded information on a top secret Imperial project code named: Dark Forces. Not much is know about it except that the project is being researched at a remote Imperial Research Facility in the secluded Rykyao System...

boardgame.name: Do You Have What It Takes?
boardgame.description:
Test your investigative skills and join a top-secret unit with QuestAir! Designed by air force fighter pilots, your escape game in a box features 12 intricate puzzle cards that lead you and your teammates through thrilling challenges. Scribble, search, and calculate, typing your findings into our interactive website. Do you have what it takes? Find out with your escape room game!

Immerse yourself in a world of riddles, codes, and secrets with your interactive game! Though complex in design, your game is simple to follow and includes helpful hints if you get stumped. Log onto the corresponding website using your game’s code to type in answers, check their validity, and complete your tryout’s stages. Pore over your 12 puzzle cards, investigating answers like a super spy, scribbling notes, calculating problems, and searching for answers. After you’ve completed all 12 cards and entered your correct answers, you officially become part of our top-secret intelligence unit!

boardgame.name: Ahsoka Source Book
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

During the Siege of Mandalore, the former Padawan Ahsoka Tano led the Grand Army of the Republic's assault against Darth Maul's forces. Following a lightsaber duel, she manages to trap Maul inside a ray shield. A year after the establishment of the Galactic Empire, Ahsoka is in hiding on the planet Thabeska. Adopting the pseudonym "Ashla," she finds refuge and work with the Fardi clan, a powerful and wealthy local family involved in smuggling. On the first Empire Day, the Fardi nieces come to her house to inform her that there are Imperial officers in town, who want to meet all the new people. Eager to stay out of the Empire's eye, Ahsoka tells the girls that she'll be at the Fardi house later, and prepares to leave the planet. She gathers her few belongings and heads for the spaceport, setting her blaster to explode in order to lure the stormtroopers on duty away from the ships. Ahsoka takes one of the Fardis' freighters, mentally apologizing for the theft.

User summary:

Ahsoka is a novel written by E. K. Johns and published by Lucasfilm Press, 2016. This item is a fan-created adaptation of the novel for tabletop roleplaying. It is presented with the trade dress of West End Games.

boardgame.name: Outbreak on Adrastea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While performing a search and rescue operation on the moon Adrastea, the team is faced with an outbreak of the Insurrection Virus that is cut off as desperate to spread.

Outbreak on Adrastea is a One-Sheet Scenario designed for use with Shadows Over Sol: Science Fiction Horror Roleplaying and the Jovian Whispers campaign and sourcebook.

boardgame.name: Guide to TIE Fighters
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Guide to TIE Fighters is a fan-created compilation of various fighter images and statistics, intended for tabletop roleplaying. It is presented with the trade dress of West End Games.

boardgame.name: Starships Stats
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Starships Stats is a fan-created resource, presenting numerous starships with images and stat blocks, intended for tabletop roleplaying. It is presented with the trade dress of West End Games.

This item has been revised and expanded - see Starships Stats: Revised & Expanded

boardgame.name: Adtherpe's Natural Materials
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

HERBS, ALCHEMY, HARVESTING

Adtherpe the Spontaneous collected all sorts of information on the multi-verse, its natural resources and the numerous creatures that inhabit it. Within this small tome he has included knowledge on their locations, composition, and they valuable materials they can provide. Also included are notes and recipes for using and crafting herbal mixtures, alchemical compounds, and and guidance on harvesting the valuable materials needed for them. A sample of useful material that will enhance any gamemaster's table!

boardgame.name: Pizza Puzzles: Meat Lovers
Pizza Puzzles: Veggie Supreme
boardgame.description:
Pizza Puzzles bring delicious art and a fun jigsaw puzzle experience to your table. Our pizzas are silly and fun to look at, but more importantly, they're puzzles you can build with your friends and family. A single slice is just one of eight smaller puzzles in the box. As you complete each smaller puzzle, you can assemble the entire pizza by slice. On each pizza you'll find countless toppings - the more you look, the more details you'll find!

Puzzles come with symbols on the back of the pieces, allowing you to assemble your puzzle by slice! Pick your preferred slice (maybe the one with your favorite topping) and chow down. Friends and family can race to finish their piece of the pie.

The Dark Times is a supplement that addresses...what it means to be one of the hunted Jedi in an era of darkness. In these pages you'll find details on how the the Emperor's genocide of the Jedi Order after the execution of Order 66 and what exactly he did to ensure the death of the order – and most importantly, how he failed.

boardgame.name: Mille Fiori
boardgame.description:
In Reiner Knizia's Mille Fiori (meaning Thousand Flowers), you take the role of glass manufacturers and traders who want to profit as much as they can from their role in the production of fine glass art.

The game board features different aspects of the glass production cycle: workshops where the glass is created, houses where it's installed, people who support your work, trade shops where it's sold, and the harbor where ships take the glass to faraway locations. You want to be present in all of these areas, preferably at just the right time to maximize your earnings. The gameboard features 109 spaces, with one card in the deck for each of those spaces.

At the start of a round, each player receives a hand of five cards. Each player chooses a card from hand, then passes the remaining cards to the next player, then each player plays their card in turn, beginning with the round's start player and typically placing a diamond-shaped token of their color in the location depicted on that card:


In the Workshops, you score 1 point for each of your tokens in a connected group with the newly placed token, doubling that score if you played on a pigment field.
In the Residences, you score the listed number of points, and if your token is preceded in the line by one or more tokens of your color, you score those previously played tokens again.
In the Townspeople area, you score 1, 3 or 6 points based on the height of your token in the pyramids, but you can only place at higher levels if the lower spaces are filled. Double your points if the card symbol matches the space your filled. Supporting tokens score again as higher tokens are placed.
In the Trade shops, four types of goods are present, and when you place a token, each token on that goods type scores for its owner points equal to the number of goods of that type now covered.
In the Harbor, you move your ship equal to the number on the played card, scoring points based on the space where you land, then place a token in one of the five rows. When that row is filled with three ships, each token in that row scores for its owner 1/3/6/10 points depending on the number of trade goods in that row.


Alternatively, you can play a card for ship movement points and not place a token on the game board.

Each player plays four cards in a round (in a 3 or 4 player game), then adds the last card in hand to those displayed beside the game board, then the start player marker rotates and you begin a new round.

For each of the five areas, you can meet a certain condition that allows you to play a bonus card from those beside the game board, e.g., in the Workshops when you place the third card that surrounds a bonus card symbol, or in the Trade shops when you score a goods type that gives someone else more points than you. When you play a bonus card, you might trigger another bonus card... and then another!

Additionally, there are five different ways to score substantial bonus points for the areas, e.g., in the Residences you need to place tokens on houses of four different values, and in the Townspeople area you need to place tokens on all three types in a pyramid. You can only score each area's bonus once, and importantly each time a bonus is claimed then the value available for later players is reduced.

When someone has placed their final diamond token or when you can't deal a new hand of five cards to each player, then the game ends and the player with the most successful glass dynasty (most points) is declared the winner.

Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 70 Minuten Altersempfehlung: ab 10 Jahre
Mille Fiori - Im Glanz der Lagune Die Glasherstellung ist seit jeher eines wohlgehtetsten Geheimnisse der Lagune. Ursprnglich wurden die Glasfen nur aus Brandschutzgrnden auf eine benachbarte Insel ausgelagert. Doch schon kurze Zeit spter wurde aus der, bis dahin relativ bedeutungslosen Insel, eines der berhmtesten Zentren fr Glasherstellung und Glaskunst. Den Handwerkern war es - unter Androhung der Todesstrafe verboten die Geheimnisse ihres Handwerks preis zu geben.
Im Glanz der Lagune: In Mille Fiori erschaffen Spieler:innen ihre eigenen Glas-Dynastien
Anker lichten, Segel setzen und auf in das sagenumwobene Land der Glaskunst die Lagune. Gemeinsam entdecken die Spieler:innen dort die Kultur der Nobili und Populi in ihrer vollsten Pracht und versuchen durch strategisch-taktisches Geschick eine erfolgreiche Glas-Dynastie aufzubauen. Dafr sichern sich die Spieler:innen verschiedene Rohstoffe, handeln mit hergestellten Glaswaren und bereiten diese fr den Transport nach Europa vor. Dabei erwarten die Spieler:innen einige Herausforderungen und Abenteuer. Wer am Ende die meisten Punkte sammeln konnte, gewinnt Mille Fiori von Reiner Knizia.
Familienspiel/ Brettspiel mit einfachen Regeln Starke Interaktion durch Karten Drafting Mechanismus Transpartente Spielsteine - Mehr als nur ein "Gimmick" "Klassisches" Knizia Spiel: Hohe Spieltiefe
Inhalt: 1 Spielplan 120 transparente Rauten 4 transparente Schiffe 4 transparene 110 Karten

boardgame.name: Zealand 1985
boardgame.description: One of the parts of the Warsaw Pact plan to attack into the west was to invade Danish Zealand, along with the capital, Copenhagen. An improvised corps, including the 6th Airborne Division, 7th Sea Landing Division and the 15th Mechanized Division, was prepared for this operation. The Soviet units and the regiment from German Democratic Republic's army were kept in reserve. The opponent of the Poles was the "Zealand" Corps. Important part of the planned strike was the usage of nuclear missiles.

boardgame.name: Great Northern War: Kalisz 1706
boardgame.description:
Game covers several battles of the "Polish" part of the Great Northern War, a major conflict fought at the beginning of XVII century, when Saxony, Russia and Dennmark attacked Sweden. Thanks to the leadership skills of the Carolux XII, Swedish army won several battles during this war.

"Kalisz 1705" allows to recreate couple of battles of this war - small scale skirmish at Tylewice 1704, medium battle - Poniec 1704 and two major battles - Wschowa (Fraustadt) 1706 and Kalisz 1706.

Game uses Husaria system rules, slightly modiefied for the more infantry based battles than usually in this system.

boardgame.name: Kittens Love Sushi
boardgame.description:
In Kittens Love Sushi, your goal is to lure 5 kittens, from the street, into your home, by using sushi as the currency that attracts them—all while other players attempt to thwart your progress, of course. It's guaranteed to be one of the most adorable games about kittens, or sushi, that you ever play.

Each turn, players fill their hand to 4 cards. Players play a single action from their hand each turn, then play a number of sushi cards to attract a "kitten" from the row of kitten cards on the board into their house.

The first player to rescue 5 kittens wins.

boardgame.name: Ooze
boardgame.description:
As you play Ooze, your goal is to collect the ingredients necessary to make the tastiest smoothie, according to those listed on "recipe" cards. Those who make the most delicious drink, win the game! And, of course, you're an even bigger winner if you actually play this game while sipping on a smoothie—which I highly recommend.

Each player has a hand of 8 cards and draws one card and discards one card each turn. If a card is discarded with a special action, follow the card text.

Each player has 5 turns of drawing/discarding. At the end of this the player wins the round who has the most ingredients in their hand from a smoothie recipe in their hand. Ties are broken with any "base" cards (milk, juice, or water) that might also be in the hand.

The player winning 3 rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: D6 Conversion: Scum and Villainy
boardgame.description:
User summary:

boardgame.name: RED
boardgame.description:
Little Red Riding Hood is back, and she wants her revenge against The Big Bad Wolf. How will she get it? Well, she's acquired a couple of supernatural powers, of course! Namely, the ability to create multiples of herself, and make forest trees sprout up suddenly from the ground. Will it be enough to show the wolf she means business? In this 2 player game, you play as either Red or the Wolf, and then switch roles to play again.

The Red player draws 3 cards a turn and places them in an expanding grid with new cards touching an old card orthogonally.

The Wolf player moves one space a turn orthogonally or diagonally trying to "eat" any "Red" card by entering that card's space.

The match ends when the deck is exhausted or the Wolf is surrounded on all sides and plays a "Red" card on top of the Wolf.

Then players switch roles and play another match. The winner is the wolf who eats the most "Red" cards.

This expansion for Kaiju Siege comes with an alternate game board and 4 new kaiju. Battles may now take place out at sea, where your workers run the risk of falling overboard, and the kaiju can damage your ship's hull and cause it to spring a leak. This understandably introduces a new losing condition - your ship can sink!

The four new kaiju are also compatible with the game board from the base game.
