boardgame.name: December 2020
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Within this document are 23 pages of content for the 1st Edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying game, including new content for the Barbarian, Bard, Legendary bard, Druid, Legenary Magus, Skald, and Sorcerer!

boardgame.name: January 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This month primarily focused on content for the Akashic Magic subsystem published by Dreamscarred Press! Included are new akashic racial subtypes, new akashic archetypes for the Antipaladin, Cavalier, Paladin and Rogue.

boardgame.name: February 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New content focusing on Akasha, with some inclusions featuring Spheres of Might! Check out new archetypes for the Rajah, Scholar, Stormbound and Striker that blend Spheres of Might and Akasha, a new spider-themed akashic archetype for the Vigilante, new Akashic Feats and Traits, new set of necromancy themed veils, and conversions of weapon and armor

boardgame.name: March 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

March's compilation from Studio M— containsa variety of new content: new necromancy-flavored archetypes for the druid, legendary bard, legendary wizard, monk and rogue, a new eldritch tome for the legendary magus, a new bloodline for the sorcerer, an astral-themed akashic archetype for the monk, a full rewrite of the vitalist for akasha, new prestige classes, new feats, and a few new veils!

boardgame.name: April 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

April's compilation from Studio M— contains a wealth of new akashic content! This month we celebrated the release of the Volur, which you can pick up here at DTRPG, adding new content and support for the class as well as some black-magic brand options for the Daevic, Rajah and Stormbound.

boardgame.name: May 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to this month’s compilation of Studio M—’s Patreon! Spheres of Akasha has finally released, and I couldn’t wait to spend a whole month celebrating with new content! You can pick it up here at DTRPG to support both me and Lost Spheres Publishing! This month’s compilation is stuffed to the brim with new content: Spheres Archetypes for nearly all the veilweaving classes, new Akashic archetypes for tons of Magic and Combat classes from Spheres, new talents, new feats, and more!

The Kheshig from Legendary Games also released in May, so I included some support for that class as well! A veil list expansion to give it some new veils, as well as proliferating some of its veils to the Volur.

boardgame.name: June 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

June was a month where I celebrated the fans of Studio M—, taking their suggestions directly for a bunch of new veil ideas!

This month also included new archetypes for the Rajah that replaced their initiating with Arcane or Divine casting, a brand new set of Title veils themed around the schools of magic, new draconic themed archetypes and draconic veilweaving themed archetypes for the Druid and Huay, a new ruleset to shape an Akashic Construct, and a Helmsman archetype utilizing the Akashic Construct!

boardgame.name: July 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

June was a month where I expanded heavily on the Spellweaver, a new class I wrote for Lost Spheres Publishing which you can pick up here.

The month also included a new set of veils focused around skirmishers, a new Stormbound archetype, new summer-themed Storm veils, and a new suite of psionic powers that interact with akasha and veils!

boardgame.name: Crowns
boardgame.description:
Kill Monsters • Raid Dungeons • Get Rich • And Try Not to Die

From the introduction:

Crowns is a tabletop roleplaying game for 2-10 players. It is built to fulfill the fantasy of a dark age where magic is real, monsters prowl the wilderness, and combat is deadly. Sometimes the best plan is one where the dice aren’t touched.

Your goal in this world is to find crowns (gold coins) in the dangerous wilderness and bring them back to settlements, the last bastions of civilization.

User summary:

The 55-page gamebook is distributed with five 1-page print-and-play sheets, used for tracking and other aspects of play.

boardgame.name: 5-Up!
boardgame.description:
Add as many of your favourite fruit the the fruit salad as possible but, don't be too obvious! The Investigator is watching, trying to deduce what your favourite fruit is! If you can get the most of your favourite fruit in the salad without getting caught, then you'll get a load of points!

Each round you will be playing and taking Fruit Cards from the middle of the table, placing them in front of you. These cards in front of you count as points at the end of the round for whoever has the matching Favourite Fruit Card.

Throw the Investigator off your trail by adding different Fruit Cards but, every Fruit Card you add that isn't your favourite might be one for someone else!

—description from the designer

boardgame.description: Monsterjäger Erweiterung contains four new "monster-thwacking" devices and 27 "shadow" monster cards that depict the 27 possible monsters from the base game, but only in silhouette. The rules in this expansion include two variants, one allowing you to play solely with the shadow cards and another that combines the two decks of monster cards.

boardgame.name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series Two
boardgame.description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

boardgame.name: Topsy Timbers
boardgame.description:
A team tower building dexterity game with elements of chance and sabotage. Teams compete to build the tallest tower with dice rolls determining a) their share of the finite collective timber resource and b) their chance at sabotaging the opposing tower with rubber band artillery. Built around a dynamic game box which converts to a dice tower for game play. The boss went home early leaving you and the crew to manage the timberyard. Grab the keys to the crane, it's time to have some fun... Build a taller tower than your friends before the timberyard runs dry!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 1877: Venezuela
boardgame.description:
1877: Venezuela is all the best parts of 1817 packed into a very small game that plays fast and comes out of the starting gate at full speed.

Short (2h) 1817-style game with a focus on short sales and financial arbitrage and sabotage

Rules changes from 1817:

Currency “$” and “Bs.” both represent the Venezuelan bolívar
There are no private companies.
Corporations can only IPO as 5-share. There are no 2-share companies in the game.
10-share companies have 10 short shares available.
When a player wins an auction to start a company, they immediately get a “housekeeping turn” where they can only do actions with the corporation they just won, (buy tokens/take loans/buy trains/redeem shares). Then the turn order resumes with the player after the player that started the auction.
The auction bid is paid to the bank. When a new corporation IPOs, the stock value is half the bid amount, rounded down. The corporation receives 2.5x the stock value and three shares are placed in the open market.
There is no restriction on when a corporation can be shorted after it has IPOed.
Corporations that formed during the current stock round can buy trains as a part of the stock round as a corporate action.
Corporations may only buy new trains from the bank, not from other corporations or the open market.
Game end trigger is the 4-train and ends after a full set of 2 ORs. There is no short sale restriction during the last stock round of the game.
When a mine tile is upgraded (yellow to green or green to brown), the company that performed the upgrade receives Bs.20 after the upgrade.

boardgame.name: Zombie Apocalypse: Rebuild Refuge
boardgame.description:
Zombie Apocalypse: Rebuild Refuge is a semi co-op party game for 3-8 players. The game takes place in a world infected by the zombie virus. Most of the residents in your society were zombified. Luckily, or unluckily, you are immune to the virus and have survived in the apocalypse. It is yet the time to let your guard down. Your first goal is to survive and if there is still any luck, you may find rescue from the outside. Therefore, you must construct refuge units in haste to stay away from danger. Not long ago, you have met some other survivors who are in a similar condition to you. Be careful! In this difficult time, no one can be trusted. They may not be your alliance! Keep your fingers crossed and watch your back!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Disuko!

Disuko! is an abstract puzzle strategy sudoku dice game in which players strive to run out of their dice first by taking turns rerolling, moving, and/or placing their dice on a 6x6 sudoku grid. Extra actions are acquired by completing sections of the board (rows, columns, boxes, or the sixth of any number). —description from the designer

boardgame.name: Elven Love
boardgame.description:
Elven Love will let you feel ancient magic on your skin! Immerse into mystical and mysterious worlds of Wood and Moon Elves. Despite shared ancestors, both races are different in many ways and falling in love between them is very unusual. For those rare occasions, they have an ancient ritual of love that must to be done for the reunion of both kin.

In this experience, you will be witnessing ceremony preparations of two elves, connected by the spiritual bond of love.

ELVEN LOVE IS VR ONLY GAME

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Lanista
boardgame.description:
You are a lanista, a gladiator school manager and trainer, aiming to become the most prestigious of Rome.

The game turn plays in four phases: Recruitment, during which you buy gladiator slaves from the market; Contract Negotiation, during which you try to place your gladiators in spectacles; Combat, during which you have your gladiators fight each other; and Healing and Resting, during which prestige may be earned from happy accidents.

The game is based on extensive historical research. The gladiator names are authentic, as well as the equipment sets and pairings.

Recruitment: On the market are gladiators. Each has a cost in gold and an equipment set (provocator, thrace, retiary, etc.). Some have special abilities.
Contract Negotiations: Various cities have gladiatorial games for tender. They rake in a certain amount of money and fame but require specific gladiator teams.
Combat: Each lanista organizes one or more fights between their own gladiators. Random draws determine the outcomes. Players can manipulate the odds in various ways.
Healing & Resting: If a gladiator physical integrity is compromised, he must be healed...or there can be an accident that yields prestige.

Random draws use a bag loaded with tokens of various colours. Players manipulate the token counts to influence the odds. This matches electoral systems used in Antiquity.

Lanista is accessible and educational; it will please newbies and grognards, be they inclined to compete or to manage.

boardgame.name: The Wagadu Chronicles
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Wagadu can be described as some sort of purgatory, a strange and wild place where people from the Upper Realms, the prosperous and more peaceful place where everyone hails from, “fall” and are stuck for good.

No one knows exactly why people fall into Wagadu but what is clear is that it’s an irreversible process and that the only thing that the Fallen can do is band together to survive the beautiful and harsh world of Wagadu.

Powerful spirits, fickle ancestors, angry beasts and magical weathers are only some of the challenges that the Fallen face but on the other hand, fertile soils, powerful magic and powerful traditions to be revived are there to reward the hardiest survivors.

Reviews
New and Upcoming Books

Rules

boardgame.name: Diana, Luna, Lucina (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vivid dreams of three beauteous goddesses and a magnificent white stag guide the party to recover a holy artifact...

Introducing a new adventure format, the Sideward Adventure Arc, a story arc adventure that allows the GM to insert the encounters anywhere within their current campaign in any order they desire without compromising player agency or roleplay. The encounters can also be played as a single one-shot style adventure.

Diana, Luna, Lucina (5e) is a Fifth Edition Compatible sideward adventure arc optimised for 4 adventurers from level 10 and up.

The party begin to have similar dreams, visions of a goddess dressed as a Huntress and a glorious white stag. She asks that the party aid her and her sisters in recovering pieces of a holy relic.

Diana, Luna, Lucina (5e) includes the following:

6 location specific maps, 6 random encounter maps.
7 custom creatures created specifically for the adventure arc.
1 custom trap, 1 custom magic item.
Backstory based on ancient pantheon and 16th century liturature.
Gameplay examples.
Each creature has been designed so that it can be printed as a creature card.

boardgame.name: Hospitality Not Included
boardgame.description:

Recent chatter picked up at The Manger state that a rule-breaking professor of archeologist has found something Divine in Turkey and CROSS wants to know what he's found. The thing is, not even the professor realizes just how big a tiger he has by the tail. Will CROSS be able to help in time?

boardgame.name: The Alien Within
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The best CROSS agents are known for their flexibility, but when early indications in a string of disappearances point to alien abduction even the most flexibile agent may feel out of his element. However, they still must investigate The Alien Within.

boardgame.name: Monumental Trouble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Washington, D.C.'s National Mall is a grand place receiving tourists wanting to revil in the grandeor of the soaring monuments, but also to thousands wanting to pay respects to the fallen at the war memmorials. Unfortunately, the latter fact has come to the attention of a misguided zealot and whenever those two personality traits come together, the agents of CROSS are never far behind.

boardgame.name: Heuschrecken Poker
boardgame.description:
In Heuschrecken Poker (Grasshopper Poker), you want to cultivate the best garden you can without letting the grasshoppers wreck it.

Each player starts with a hand of eight bidding cards: 1-6, an Ace, and an X. Three cards from the garden deck are revealed, then all players choose a card from their hand and reveal them simultaneously. Whoever plays the highest card takes all cards of one type from the display, then whoever played the next highest card takes a type, etc.

Cards come in five types: corn, strawberries, broccoli, blackberries, and grasshoppers. Place all plant cards together by type in your personal garden, with the grasshoppers at the top. If you have three cards of the same crop, remove them from play and take a point chip. If, however, you collect three grasshoppers in your garden, you must remove all cards from your garden and start again.

If you play your Ace, you collect all cards on offer instead of only one type; if you play your X, you collect nothing — except if someone has played an Ace, in which case the X steals the power of the Ace and you collect everything.

If two or more players reveal the same card, ignore those cards; if all cards are ignored, add another garden card to the pot and play again. In the event of another tie, discard all four cards and start another turn by refilling the display to three cards.

After playing eight turns, whoever has the most plant cards in their garden scores a point chip, then everyone takes their bidding cards back in hand and starts a new turn. Once the garden deck is exhausted, the game ends and whoever has the most point chips wins.

boardgame.name: Plaka
boardgame.description:
Plaka is a highly thematic Economic, about managing and expanding a Clothes Store in the old historical neighborhood of Athens, with Worker Placement and tile placement elements and a unique Flow mechanism.

In the game, players are the owners of a small clothes store and they try to operate it in a way that it will attract the most of the tourists passing by, serve them and get the most benefits from the trades. To achieve this, players hire workers and pitchmen, expand their stores trying to get the most of the small place they can use, advertise their business, and even sell some of their goods via their e-shop.

The game lasts 8 rounds.
Each turn is divided by 3 phases:
The Action Phase, that is a worker placement phase.
The Flow Phase where the micromanagement of the employees, customers and clothes happens.
The Upkeep phase, where players pay the rent and their employees, as well as they setup the game for next round.

By the end of the game, players score the customers they served, their reputation, as well as they lose some Victory Points for every customer left inside their store and the tiles on the board that were left unoccupied.

The player who managed to get the most out of their store, is the winner!

boardgame.name: Revolution & Reaction: The Spanish Civil War, 1930-39
boardgame.description:
Revolution & Reaction: The Spanish Civil War, 1930-39 is a two-player wargame, depicting the political and military conflicts in Spain between 1930 and 1939. In the game, one player controls the Republican forces (consisting of liberals, socialists, communists and anarchists), and the other controls the Nationalists (consisting of the Falangist and Carlist factions).

Players not only fight each other, but must manage and coordinate their own political and military factions. The loyalty of your factions to the cause is never certain!

The game system adapts the key mechanics of Matt Calkin's Sekigahara game (2011, GMT). Players receive a hand of cards each turn which are used to play for the actions, and to deploy game pieces into battle. In Revolution & Reaction, there is a political phase, in which players try to gain political control of the various areas of Spain by placing influence blocks; in the military phase, players move their units and start combats in locations on the board (towns cities). Blocks and cards are hidden from the other player, so the opponent's true political and military strength is only know in struggle.

The game includes diplomacy and elections, special units (such as the International Brigades), and rules to simulate the outbreak of war, giving the game a strong connection to the real history of the Spanish Civil War.

boardgame.name: Escaping The Bolsheviks: A Solo Game

boardgame.name: Take That Towers
boardgame.description:
Take That Towers is a tactical card game centered around dual-use cards with delayed effects.

Players build skyscrapers together. Each turn they'll play cards from their hand face-up to construct floors and face-down to stake their claim on the resulting real estate. Once a tower is completed, the effects of each floor will occur and players score points based on the arrangement. Score the most points before the deck runs out to win.

The game plays using a single 65 deck of square cards, and plays in a consistent amount of time regardless of the player count.

boardgame.name: The Varangian Guard Class for OSR Role Playing Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Varangian Guard were elite warriors that guarded the Byzantine Emperors and served as shock troops and mercenaries in many battles. The Varangian Guard were well known for their use of two-handed axes, toughness, skill, and aggression in battle. The Varangian Guard class is perfect for people that like to play large, tough warriors that specialize in using two-handed weapons in old school RPGs.

boardgame.name: Toggolino: Sternenfnger
boardgame.description:
Toggolino has lost his lucky star during a romp and it has shattered into many small pieces, which Toggolino and his friends now want to find.

The player whose turn it is rolls the dice: For a color he goes to the next matching field, if it is a star field, he may take a puzzle piece and put it on. As a reward, they get a colored star. If the star is rolled, the player takes a puzzle piece and gets a reward star. For the lucky star, the player moves to the next free mushroom and gets a reward star. When the star is finished, the player with the most points on his stars wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Der Maulwurf ist immer dabei
boardgame.description:
The game consists of 32 cards in 8 colors, with associated frame and a die. 4 cards of each color are placed in the frames in a certain order (predetermined by the bulges on the cards) into the frames. A set = color shows in each case the mole with his friends with different activities or events in attractive graphics. The variation of the game goes from finishing or getting to know a picture to a complicated exchange or dice game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Googly Eyed Primetime Puppet Show Role Playing Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

My goal with this book is to tap into the magic that has made us fans of these foam, felt, and fur covered characters, and their zany antics, for over 60 years.

If that sounds like the sort of thing you enjoy, by all means keep reading The Googly Eyed Primetime Puppet Show.

The show’s about to start...
boardgame.rpg: The Googly Eyed Primetime Puppet Show Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Hawgbilly!
boardgame.description:
The Swine & Sorcery RPG

From the back of the book:

"When you waller with the pigs...

...'spect to get dirty!"


What happens when mythical "hill-folk" get transformed into magical gun-wielding pigs? Hawgbilly!!

Hawgbilly! is a rootin', tootin', derned good time for everyone. Th' "Damn Pinkerton" is responsible fer comin' up with the wild and wooly adventure fer the players out thar on "Swine Mountain". Everyone else plays out the hawgs, fightin' off mountain varmits and critters to get the magical treasure!

boardgame.name: Zona and the Children of the Moon
boardgame.description:
From the book:

An Adult Solo Fantasie Gamebook in the style of the Lone Wolf gamebooks and others.

User summary:

This product putatively was NC-17 rated. It is based of a percentage system and the characters and enemies have stats. The combat system consists of combat skill, damage points, & armor ratings.

boardgame.name: Back To The Future: Dice Through Time Time Train
boardgame.description: The Time Train is a miniature modeled on the Time Train Doc Brown built in the Old West of “Back To The Future III.” It was first released as a promo for Gen Con 2020 attendees who took part in a virtual panel on the Back To The Future: Dice Through Time game. It was announced that there would be additional ways to receive this promo.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Back to the Future: Dice Through Time

boardgame.name: Mafia the Party Game Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Mafia is a game of lying, bluffing, and deceit where players try to eliminate the other team from the game. There are two teams; Mafia and Civilians. The game is divided into two phases; night and day. The Civilians win if they eliminate all the Mafia players and the Mafia win if they equal or outnumber the Civilian players. Mafia is played with a Moderator. The Moderator guides the players through the night and day phases, keeping the game on track and keeping the players engaged.

Mafia Deluxe features 47 unique roles on 84 role cards, a moderator field guide, and quick start guide.

boardgame.name: Catizens
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Inspired by The Sims, Catizens is a whimsical town management game full of snuggly and occasionally disobedient cats! Build and customize your settlement, watching it grow from a small village to a full-fledged town. Care for your furry citizens and manage their quirky personalities, as you help them explore the surrounding lands on their quest to reach the top of the Lava Meowntain.Herding cats is easy!

Said no one… ever. Your main job in Catizens is to build your town around the personality traits of its inhabitants and make the cats happy enough, so they obey you and complete level objectives.

Just like in real life, cats require personal attention and special treatment. Combinations of different personality traits and moods affect their proficiency and obedience. Catizens form relationships with each other (with both positive and negative effects on their productivity) and will occasionally issue personal requests, so you will need to learn what makes each cat happy in order to stay on their good side.

Create unique cats

Pick from an assortment of facial and body features, as well as personality traits to create cats with distinct looks and temperaments. Design a place just for them by decorating the interior of their home with pieces of furniture, plants, vases and other items.

The better furnished and nicer looking a house is, the happier your catizens will be. So get creative!

Explore the wilderness

Develop your settlement, complete objectives and expand to areas with different environments that offer new adventures. Carefully examine your surroundings to find the best fishing spots, hidden treasures and quirky characters that may offer a quest.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Gaslight Toolkit for Low Fantasy Gaming
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Transport your game to the era of Gaslight!

The Low Fantasy Gaming (LFG) system by Steve Grodzicki published by Pickpocket Press is a flexible and powerful rethinking of the d20 ruleset under the Open Game License (OGL). This Gaslight Toolkit helps GMs to convert the traditional sword-and-sorcery LFG campaign into the world of gaslight-era dark fantasy with a minimum of prep time.

Including a new way of imagining character wounds, a system for tracking morality, and advice for how to recreate the mood and themes of 19th-century dystopia, this toolkit is useful to GMs of any system.

boardgame.name: Resurrectionist Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet The Resurrectionist: a gravedigger with a knack for swinging a shovel, whose traffic with the dead and undead eventually gains him an Undead Creature as a companion.

You are a Resurrectionist, a graverobber who digs up fresh corpses and delivers them to shady “doctors” who use the bodies for “science.” Your trade is in a legal gray area -- bodies are not legal property, and therefore “resurrecting” them is not stealing...though the deceased’s friends and relatives might think otherwise.

A Victorian-themed character class compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system ready for your gaslight setting. Included in the Gaslight Characters: Volume I, This character can fit into any campaign world with Gothic themes, Steampunk trappings, or 19th century urban vibes.

boardgame.name: Detective Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Detective is the classic investigator, equipped to find and interpret clues. Includes abilities that give the player lots of adaptability and flexibility, AND help the GM make mysteries smoother at the table.

You are a sleuth, a private investigator; perhaps you are a Bow Street Runner or a Pinkerton operative. Your powers of observation are trained to incredible levels and you can’t resist a good mystery. Of course, your job puts you in conflict with some very tough customers, so self-defense is also necessary.

A Victorian-themed character class compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system ready for your gaslight setting. Included in the Gaslight Characters: Volume I, This character can fit into any campaign world with Gothic themes, Steampunk trappings, or 19th century urban vibes.

boardgame.name: Libertine Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet The Libertine: the hedonistic socialite whose beautiful appearance remains magically uninjured and youthful as long as a certain painting stays safe...

You are a socialite, a free-wheeling, hard-partying dilettante who seems to always know just the right people and be invited to all the best parties. And you have a dark secret -- one that mysteriously keeps you young, carefree, and healthy no matter how you seem to abuse your body...

A Victorian-themed character class compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system ready for your gaslight setting. Included in the Gaslight Characters: Volume I, This character can fit into any campaign world with Gothic themes, Steampunk trappings, or 19th century urban vibes.

boardgame.name: Bludger Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bludger is a thuggish, Strength-based rogue who has the expertise to survive on the merciless urban streets.

You are a bludger, a criminal known for their signature tool: the bludgeon. You find work as an enforcer, muscle for criminal bosses, or sometimes you simply “freelance.” Your work requires a combination of muscle, stealth, street smarts, and intimidation in order to stay alive and stay out of the eye of the law.

A Victorian-themed character class compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system ready for your gaslight setting. Included in the Gaslight Characters: Volume I, This character can fit into any campaign world with Gothic themes, Steampunk trappings, or 19th century urban vibes.

boardgame.name: LFG Class Pack: Gaslight Characters, Volume I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five Victorian-themed character classes compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system ready for your gaslight setting. Easily convertible to 5th Edition D&D as well. Volume I includes"

The Bludger: a thuggish, Strength-based rogue who has the expertise to survive on the merciless urban streets;
The Detective: the quintessential sleuth whose amazing powers of perpection and deduction ensure that no crime goes unsolved;
The Libertine: the hedonistic socialite whose beautiful appearance remains magically uninjured and youthful as long as a certain painting stays safe...
The Resurrectionist: a gravedigger with a knack for swinging a shovel, whose traffic with the dead and undead eventually gain him an Undead Creature as a companion;
The Unlikely Hero: an innocent drawn into the plot, seemingly a fish out of water but surprisingly capable despite their apparent unsuitability for adventure.
These characters are setting-agnostic and can fit into any campaign world with Gothic themes, Steampunk trappings, or 19th century urban vibes.

boardgame.name: Phantom Radio
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pirate radio station has been broadcasting in the capital city. The on-air talent professes to have the ability to cast spells via broadcast signals. It has been mostly dismissed as a promotional hoax to garner more listeners. Recently an outspoken opponent of the broadcast was reported to have committed suicide at the behest of the radio host. Authorities began an investigation, but have been unable to locate the source of the broadcast. The possible magical nature of this investigation means it falls under the jurisdiction of Nachtrichter. Since the investigation began, unconfirmed reports blame illness and dangerous behavior on the broadcast. The host, who identifies himself as Ahvan (a reference to the Vedician god of renewal) is believed to be a Burgundian national in his late twenties, or early thirties. Ahvan limits his broadcasts to around thirty minutes each night. He broadcasts once a day, always after sundown. The content of his show is a mixture of political rants and magical theory. Most listeners believe it is entertainment and don’t take the assertions of magical ability seriously. The show is broadcast on a different frequency every night. Somehow his audience is able to locate the show. You are assigned to locate the source of this illegal broadcast, shut it down, and apprehend the figure known as Ahvan.

boardgame.name: Granite Isle Atlas & Adventure Unit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A island under the thimb of a concerned Lord mayor who want to keep power and an employment option from a miners guild to go places the Lord Mayor does not want anyone to go. In this adventure gaining information without being discovered meaans success and discovery may mean death.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: City Block Builder
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





The 1950s. Los Angeles is in the midst of a cultural revolution and is bustling with immense amounts of growth throughout the city. Get ready to build your business empire while tackling multiple challenges that come your way.THE AMERICAN DREAM IS HERE

Los Angeles Is In The Midst Of A Cultural Revolution And Is Bustling With Immense Amounts Of Growth Throughout The City.

The Time To Build And Invest Is Now!

SET IN 1950S LOS ANGELES

Carve Out A Name For Yourself In The City Of Stars And Experience The Golden Era Of America!

California Has Never Looked Better And Is The Place To Be.

RUN MULTIPLE BUSINESSES


Cinemas
Restaurants
Bowling Alleys
Drive-Ins
Jazz Clubs And A LOT More!


IN-DEPTH RESEARCH TREE

Each Business Has Its Own Extensive Research System With Different Nuances.

Higher Costs Unlock Better Rewards.

MULTIPLE MODES


Campaign Mode
Sandbox Mode
Scenario Mode


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: City of Atlantis
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Atlantis has resurfaces. Now it is up to you to rebuild and survive.User Summary

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Nian (promo character)
boardgame.description: Nian (traditional Chinese: ; pinyin: nián shòu) is one of the country specific promo monsters for King of Tokyo and King of New York. (Taiwan)

listing.notes:
I am selling the promo monster available only in Taiwan. Completely new, never used.
Payment by paypal. Choose the method: Friends/family, please.
Careful shipment. Registered letter, delivered upon signature.
Do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

boardgame.name: Comet 64
boardgame.description:
1984, february.
outside, it's dark. -and raining.
it might have started five minutes or five days ago.
hard to tell.
I've been coding.
if I stare at the screen long enough
answers come to me.
that's my super power.
outside, the city is sleeping.
but the caret is blinking at me.
and this new disk I got,
it's brutal.

OPERATORS WANTED
Comet 64 is a programming puzzle game. The year is 1984. All you got is a Comet 64 home computer and the operator's manual it came with.
DOCUMENTATION PROVIDED

Read the documentation (exist both in-game, and as a pdf) and figure out how to operate this 80s computer.
Learn its assembly-like (but not quite) programming language.
Solve 50+ input - output processing puzzzles.
Improve your solution and compete to minimize your instruction and cycle counts.
Solve bonus visual grid-based puzzles.
Discover secrets of the machine.


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Creepy Tale 2
boardgame.description:
Experience the creepy tension of a brother’s Grimm fairy tale in this puzzle adventure game. Follow the young and brave Lars as he embarks on a dangerous journey to save his sisters mind from the clutches of a mysterious evil.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Worldspanner Factions, Set 1: Heroes
boardgame.description:
Worldspanner Factions is the grand successor to the Duel of Ages series of games. A combination of tactical RPG and adventure, Factions carries on the tradition of intensity and uniqueness. Two decades have proven that you've never played a game like this.

Two teams of heroes from past, present, and future descend into the Worldspanner Arena and compete to earn the most glory by acts of renown--and by facing down the enemy. Earn the alliance of one of the six factions, or the queen mother of the Games. For 2-8 players who divide into two teams. In effect, a co-op game with excellent opponent AI (unless your friends dump-statted INT).

The teams take turns, conducting an action with each hero--move, attack, unleash a minion. This is followed by reactions from the opposing team, after which the current team conducts adventures. Play continues for 9 or 12 turns, after which objective points are tallied. Most objective points are earned from non-combat activities such as alliances with the different factions.

Contains 48 heroes, 90 treasures and a selection of map pieces, making each play is different--new teams gathering new treasure on a completely new map. Expansions bring both the treasure count and the hero count up to 360--The Full Degree.

With a ruleset significantly streamlined from Duel of Ages, Factions has half the rules word count of Duel of Ages I and over a third less than DoA II. Factions is now a game system capable of pulling in a universe of heroes (and their miniatures).

boardgame.name: 18DE: Germany
boardgame.description:
18DE: Germany – This is a more conventional operational game that uses the great merger/conversion system from 1817, but strips out the short selling. It plays fast and it feels like a full game experience in only 3-4 hours.

Medium (3-4h) 1817-style game, but with no short sales.

Rules changes from 1817:
- No short selling
- No NY, but there are OO tiles (tile layer chooses orientation and token placement like in 1830).
- OO tiles use the route restriction from the NY tiles in 1817 (may not include both cities in a hex on the same route).
- New private company auction process
- All set out for sale, put $10 chip bonus money on each private company (player that drafts the card gets the bonus money)
- PD goes first (keeps PD), may select a private company or pass (out of current round of draft if pass), then take turns around the table drafting or passing a private company until all have passed.
- Pass PD to next player and place a $10 chip on remaining private companies.
- Repeat this process until all sold, PD goes to the next player in turn order after the player that drafted the last item
- New private companies
- River Bridge Builders, face value 60
- One time use. Owning company may place a tile of the next available color out of phase in a OO hex following the normal track building rules.
- Western Europe Connections, face value 40
- Owning company may place the red “W” tile on Brussels, Amsterdam, or Paris (match orientation). If not placed during its first operation, any company may place it during their operation.
- Eastern Europe Connections, face value 40
- Owning company may place the red “E” tile on Warsaw, Prague, Vienna (match orientation). If not placed during its first operation, any company may place it during their operation.
- “E” and “W” tiles
- This tile now counts as a 10 revenue off-board area. If a route contains both the “E” and “W” off-board areas, it also includes the respective bonuses (“+”) revenue in the route’s value per the phase color. Both hexes must be counted in a single train’s run to earn the bonuses.
- E tile (may be placed in Amsterdam, Brussels, Paris--match spikes)
- 2 connections, 10 value, +40,+50,+70,+100
- W tile (may be placed in Warsaw, Prague, Vienna--match spike)
- 1 one connection, 10 value, +40,+50,+70,+100

boardgame.name: Project Luna
boardgame.description:
In the near future, corporations of Earth get the mandate to explore and exploit the Moon for resources and science in order to push forward humanity's dream of living among the stars. You, as a player, are placed in a position of a manager on Luna.

Your job is to, first, make your colony as self sustaining as possible by playing different projects, making way for advanced industries and science that build up the prestige of your company - the main parameter for determining the victor in the end. Everything in game is based on hard science - no sci-fi elements included.

During the turn, players have a lot of options - playing cards, rolling dice to research new tech and build decks of cards, place buildings on the map and move units on the same map. They can trade on a common and ever changing market, start missions (represented by some other cards) on distant planets, and finish tasks from the common deck.

The game ends when any player finishes a series of secret task (agendas) that he gets via cards at the game's start. That turn becomes the last one.

The player wins by accumulating the most victory points (prestige points in game) that are gathered through various actions during the game.
